text: George Catlett Marshall (December 31, 1880 â€“ October 16, 1959) was an American military leader. He was Chief of Staff of the Army, Secretary of State, and the third Secretary of Defense. Marshall served as the United States Army Chief of Staff during World War II. As Secretary of State, his name was given to the Marshall Plan. For this plan, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1953. Marshall joined the US Army in 1902. He served in France during World War I. ==References== Category:1880 births Category:1959 deaths Category:American people of World War II Category:Politicians from Pennsylvania Category:Time People of the Year Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:United States Secretaries of State Category:United States Secretaries of Defense Category:Honorary Knights Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath
title: George Marshall
